tripreview.Title: "Do not miss the Martial Arts"
tripreview.sentence: I went there to book the Kathakali show tickets, but on my husbands insistence, we ended up getting the tickets for the Martial arts show as well.
Much has been said about the Kathakali show and it is definitely something to go for.
Do not miss the make-up as they explain some of the basics during that process and it is fun to watch the transformation process.
The real discovery was however the martial arts show.
There were only a few people watching the show (7 in total) The two guys put together a jaw dropping performance.
You are left amazed at the hard work these people have put their bodies through and the craft they have learnt.
The narrator also explains each move/weapon, so it is an informational session as well.
I felt sorry at the end thfat I did not know what talents my country has kept hidden.
They do not get enough visitors and this being their only source of income; it is heart wrenching to see that this dedication has not lent them fruits they deserve.
In all it is a performance by really hard-working people, put forth with utmost honesty and dedication.
If you have just one thing to do in Kochi, go to the Kerala Kathakali Center.

tripreview.Title: "The best part of my day each day"
tripreview.sentence: Kathakali is very alien to me, but it was great to see one show.
However they have a large offer of music and dance and arts and we ended up going there every evening of our stay, and coming back for more the next evening.
The musicians were really good and there are few people, so you can really loose yourself in the music.

tripreview.Title: "Concentrate on the demo!"
tripreview.sentence: Kathakali show was amazing traditional show ever!
I would say it's an amazing performance as it challenges our analytical thinking to interpret on each signs express by the performers.
Go and check it out!
It's only about 5 dollars per show.

tripreview.Title: "A fascinating and enjoyable experience"
tripreview.sentence: We enjoyed our visit here very much.
The demonstration of putting on the make-up was very well done and interesting.
The performance itself was entertaining and well explained.

tripreview.Title: "DO NOT MISS THIS!"
tripreview.sentence: Our experience at Kathakali Centre changed our lives!
We went there every single day for the various events: Theatre play, classical music, and of course Yoga and meditation.
The gourou is incredibly friendly and interesting, and the atmosphere is just out of this world!
Do not go to Kochi without spending at least one evening there!

tripreview.Title: "Very interseting"
tripreview.sentence: An enjoyable and educational show starts by the artist putting on their makeup and then an explanation of the intricate facial movements of the artist followed by a performance of the Katakali dancers.

tripreview.Title: "A mix of traditional Kerala colors"
tripreview.sentence: They were awesome and they did real good.
The Kathakali show was one of the highlights of my trip.
Did take quite a few photos safely stored in my picasa albums.
The artists showed us all that we needed to know from actions to vocals.
Their attire was unique and we loved their performance.
A must try when in kerala.

tripreview.Title: "Stunning"
tripreview.sentence: It is great to be able to see the artists putting on their make-up ( which is a real work of art ) before the performance.

The introduction before the real performance is fascinating with an excellent explanation of how the moves and expressions of the performers portray different emotions - this leads into the final performance which is breath taking.

tripreview.Title: "An enlightening experience"
tripreview.sentence: I've been to Kerala a couple of times previously and have seen Kathakali dance forms before.
They have been largely undecipherable.

But this Centre took the trouble to allow guests to view the make-up process, to explain the meaning of colours and how they help to identify the persona of the masked character, to show the different eye and facial movements and how they express emotion and intention.
A shortened (from 9 hours in the old days), classic episode was then played out, illustrating many of these points, providing much-needed clarity to this dance form.
Of course, this is not just dance, but a religious and spiritual experience, drawing on the ancient Mahabharata.
For a pair of westerners like us, this was enlightening.

tripreview.Title: "Fascinating and authentic"
tripreview.sentence: As many here have already said, this is a fascinating insight into the kathakali art form demonstrated by people who seem passionate and knowledgable.
We also did the yoga morning class and morning raga meditations, the yoga was wonderful, and the the ragas a very interesting experience (felt a bit like the Beatles in the 60's!

tripreview.Title: "Worth it"
tripreview.sentence: Travellers to Fort Kochi must not miss this.
In my opinion its an authentic Kathakali Center in Kochi, compared to some which are more commercial in nature.
Watched 2 shows - loved it.

tripreview.Title: "Fascinating"
tripreview.sentence: The makeup is a art that takes 4 years to perfect and the movement demonstration was fabulous and explained so much of what was happening in the performance that followed.
The Katakali was only a snapshot of a performance that can last many more hours.

tripreview.Title: "Tabla and Sitar concert"
tripreview.sentence: I did not attend a dance performance as my tour scheduled one at a different venue.
But having read so much about the kathakali center I wanted to go, and so booked a concert.
It is an intimate traditional hall and the concert had two very talented local musicians who had not played together before so it was interesting to see them react to each other.
There were good explanations of the varying pieces they performed and a chance to interact with the musicians afterward.
All in all a very satisfying experience.

tripreview.Title: "Delightful"
tripreview.sentence: I went early to watch them putting on the makeup, which is quite fascinating in itself.
Before the main performance, a demonstration is given with explanations of the subtleties of the performance.
The eyes, the mudras, the color of the makeup everything has a significance.
Before the main performance, a demonstration is given with explanations of the subtleties of the performance.
The heavy makeup is all made from the same traditional, natural materials that have been used for humdreds of years.
Everything was very well done and very much worth seeing.
Highly recommended.

tripreview.Title: "Traditional Theatre"
tripreview.sentence: India is not a country which has many theatres as we in the West know them.
Here in Kochi there are several places to see traditional religious plays.
But, fortunately for foreign visitors, each venue gives a short performance, only a couple of hours !
The show is colourful and fascinating.
Some venues are proper theatres.
This Centre is one well known, while others are very simple.
be sure to go.
Cost about 350 rupees.

tripreview.Title: "It's too long but interesting !"
tripreview.sentence: The preparation before performance was intriguing .
the auditorium is poky and stuffy .

tripreview.Title: "Divine Cultural Show..........."
tripreview.sentence: We watched Kathakali dance on 01.09.13.
It was well performed and explained musical show.
Quite comfortable air conditioned auditorium.
We prefer Kerala Kathakali Centre compare to the one in Munnar.
In KKC the show was performed with a lot respect and in a very divine way, the singer was good.
The only drawback in KKC is that, they do not have photo session with the characters.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent cultural activities"
tripreview.sentence: I went for two shows at the Kerala Kathakali Centre - a Kathakali show and an Indian classical music concert (tabla and sitar).
Both shows were brilliant!

I was especially delighted by the fact that they explained the origin, significance and some basic expressions in Kathakali before the actual show - without which one might be lost during the performance.
The tabla and sitar are my favorite combination of Indian classical instruments and the artists that performed the show were such a treat!

tripreview.Title: "A cultural masterpiece"
tripreview.sentence: The discipline behind the art is one that is rarely highlighted.
At the Kerala Kathakali Centre, you get to first experience the make-up session of the performers.
Next this goes into an explanation of the art of Kathakali followed by a series of demonstrations.
Lastly the show goes on.
It's definitely something that you'll have to witness yourself.
the show can be frantic, exaggerated, elaborate.
Go see it!

tripreview.Title: "You can't even fall to sleep because of the horrible noise"
tripreview.sentence: I've never experienced a performance so terrible.

tripreview.Title: "Good performance"
tripreview.sentence: Good way to introduce the idea of Kathakali to foreigners.
Nice scene.
Then it's an introduction to explain the meaning of different gestures used in kathakali performances.
And at the end a short scene from one of the plays on Hindu gods and demons.
The last part is very loud - oh, yes it's India, so it must get noisy sometime, somewhere
it's Indians' secret how they survived a Kathakali plays which lasted 6 hours
Anyway it was interesting experience.
Ticket was 250 rupees if I'm not mistaken.

tripreview.Title: "worth a visit"
tripreview.sentence: I enjoyed the way the performance was broken down so that there was an explanation of the language of Kathakali.

tripreview.Title: "Color and Culture"
tripreview.sentence: This is my first experience of any traditional dances.
I would suggest skipping the elaborate make-up session which is before the actual show.
Instead of going for two hours, cut it down to 45 minutes if you are interested in just understanding what Kathakali is all about.
As you enter the place looks quite old and ancient but surprisingly the theatre is air conditioned, good seating arrangements and clean.
Since the theatre is small, the music could be loud.
The whole act is based on a story, so you have little pamphlets in English which give you an idea about the characters and gist of the story line.
We sneaked in back stage to take some pictures with the dancers who were kind enough to oblige.
I am aware there might be a lot of videos and pictures of this form of art, but experiences it first hand is wonderful.

tripreview.Title: "excellent visit"
tripreview.sentence: go and see this if you want to experience the art and culture of kerala.

tripreview.Title: "Very boring, too loud!!!"
tripreview.sentence: The kathakali show was so boring that we left the theater 30 minutes before ending
We came one hour earlier to see the make up.
The costumes were nice but music was toooo loud :/ for us it wasn't interesting.
Never would go there again!
Not recommend it!
2 hours could be spend better!

tripreview.Title: "Great way to experience Kathakali!"
tripreview.sentence: I've enjoyed performances here both times I've been in Fort Kochi and find it an excellent way to sample Kathakali.
Traditional Kathakali performances can last up to nine hours-- I was happy to be able to sample a one-hour performance.
The best part though is the demonstration of the eye movements at the beginning!

tripreview.Title: "Excellent arena to watch Kathakali"
tripreview.sentence: We visited two separate Kathakali performances whilst in Kochi but it was the one at the Kerala Kathakali Centre that really stood out.
The venue is a beautiful wood fitted theatre and all of the performers were very charismatic.
The explanations prior to the performance were very well executed and the Air condition is always a nice touch when you've been walking around in the heat all day.
We returned to watch the martial arts performance a few days later and were equally impressed by this as well.
The centre offers a real variety of entertainment and educational performances for a reasonable price, all of which is delivered with a real professional touch.
Highly recommended.

tripreview.Title: "Exceeded expectations.."
tripreview.sentence: After experiencing a few Kathakali performances this company was by far our favourite.
The Master of ceremony is very informative and his live singing was mesmorising.
The actors here were, for us, the best Fort Cochin has to offer.
We also attended a live martial arts demonstration which again blew us away.
All this, in a beautiful theatre.

tripreview.Title: "Bit too long!"
tripreview.sentence: We arrived around 15 minutes before the show started and got to see some of the make up being put on.
the kathakali was slightly interesting but not sure I could watch a whole hour of it.
the show was a bit too long for our group.
A lot of yawns and restlessness in our seats.
Also contemplated leaving after the 60 minute mark.
I appreciate the years they take to learn their art but it's not something I recommend as a 'must do' in Kerala.

tripreview.Title: "I know them personally...they are dedicated artists"
tripreview.sentence: As a local person I know them very well and I never see such a team as they are so dedicated artists and explains the story to the visitors, so they can easily understand the meaning of the Mudras

tripreview.Title: "Deserve a visit"
tripreview.sentence: Different, deserves a visit to see the show.
Nice to see how they paint themselves and good story tellers.

tripreview.Title: "Personal and individual attention"
tripreview.sentence: The show was very interesting.
It explains the dance very clearly and interestingly to all in English.

tripreview.Title: "Kerala Kathakali Center - Discover New Talents"
tripreview.sentence: The Kerala Kathakali Centre was founded in 1990 in Fort Kochi , the oldest city in Kerala and known as the Queen of the Arabian Sea .
The Kerala Kathakali Center aim's to popularize and encourage the classical arts of Kerala and they are doing an incredible job.
Various traditional arts and rituals are also encouraged and performed at this Centre.

tripreview.Title: "KATHAKALI CETER,COCHIN"
tripreview.sentence: The Kerala Kathakali Centre was founded in 1990 in Kochi , the oldest city in Kerala and known as the Queen of the Arabian Sea .

tripreview.Title: "Good Show!"
tripreview.sentence: We went to Kerala Kathakali Center which is situated near Santa Cruz Basilica and it was a great experience to see live performances of Odhisi, Mohiniattam and Bharatnatyam dances.

tripreview.Title: "Insightful and emotional dance!"
tripreview.sentence: They have almost everyday presentations.
The actors studied this art for more than 10 yesrs and they are really experts on it.
I felt really good watching the presentation, it was like an art master piece.

tripreview.Title: "Must see show in Kerala."
tripreview.sentence: A wonderful, colourful Cultural experience, enhanced with the ability to be present during the make up session.
A small insight to the Kerala culture.

tripreview.Title: "good visual treat"
tripreview.sentence: It was my dream to watch kathakali show.
eventhough it was in a Jam mode, appreciate the work of artists.

tripreview.Title: "Definitely worth a visit"
tripreview.sentence: My boyfriend and I went there as part of our Kerala trip.
Although it is difficult to understand, the makeup and costumes are just amazing and impressive.
A great job is done, and the price is low.
the show is a little bit long, but a nice cultural experience which we recommend.

tripreview.Title: "An Audio Visual Delight..."
tripreview.sentence: I had it on my mind for quite a long time and my Kerala Trip would not have been complete without it.
We went there a bit early to see the the amazing makeup and prep work.
I must say that it simply is a magical experience.
I have always appreciated genuine art and culture in all its forms and this one is just spectacular.
These guys are thorough professionals and have kept the folklore alive.
I pity those who don't get it.
You'll love it!

tripreview.Title: "brilliant artists"
tripreview.sentence: the makeup and there acting is unbelievable.

tripreview.Title: "Superb. A must for everyone interested in the arts"
tripreview.sentence: The experience was wonderful.

tripreview.Title: "A performance and then some!"
tripreview.sentence: Watching the performers apply their makeup before the show was interesting in itself.
Great price!

tripreview.Title: "Excellent Performance"
tripreview.sentence: The performance was really marvelous.
The performance was really mind blowing.
It is a must watch and worth every penny.

tripreview.Title: "Good experience"
tripreview.sentence: Thoroughly enjoyed this performance, even though it is geared towards foreigners.
It gave of the opportunity to learn about Kathakali and observe short performances.
I would say that it is a must-do if you don't plan on seeing any other Kathakali in Kerala.

tripreview.Title: "Keralan martial arts - amazing display"
tripreview.sentence: We went to the Kerala Kathakali Centre to see their evening kathakali show and it was really great.
I'd definitely recommend it.
It's worth going an hour early too to watch the actors make up as the transformation is incredible!
We also went to see a traditional Keralan martial arts performance in the same theatre.
Even if you are not interested in martial arts it is an amazing display of speed and skill.

tripreview.Title: "Best value theatre (and cultural visit) in Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: Visited at end of April 2013.
Suggest arrive in tie or the face make-up session which starts at 5:00 pm and can go on well past an hour.
Main performance is introduced by n explanation of the skills acquired during he 6 years a he dancers, singers Nd drummers have to go through to reach this standard.
Spent a little time afterwards talking to the singer/narrator who was absolutely charming.
Really good value for money - r250 for almost 2and1/2 hours trilling entertainment.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting and Informative"
tripreview.sentence: It is well worth arriving in time to watch the makeup session as you are able to take photographs.
The care and attention to detail in the application of the make up alone is fascinating.
There is an explanation and demonstration of the various hand movements and facial expressions which is helpful along with a handout outlining the story being performed.
The performance itself last for about an hour - it is certainly interesting and very different.
I had never heard of Kathakali until seeing the performance.

The centre appears to be respected and well used - there are martial arts performances as well as yoga, meditation and other activities so it is worth taking the time to check what else may be going on there if you are spending a few days in Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Never seen eyes move like that!"
tripreview.sentence: Make- up session starts at 5 pm till 6 pm, but it' s no problem if you arrive towards the end of the session.
But DON'T miss it altogether!
It 's fascinating to watch the make- up being put on and the paper being cut and applied to the actors face.
After the make -up session one of the actors shows eye movements and facial expressions,and this is almost the best part of the show!
I have never seen eyes move like that!
The musicians are excellent and so are the dancers.
The fee is ridiculously low, 250 rupees.

tripreview.Title: "Worth a visit"
tripreview.sentence: We went to the evening performance and watched the make being applied, I do hope there was no lead in the paint!
The explanation of the movements is essential to your understanding of the performance.
The drummer boy is superb and it is very interesting if a little 'odd'.
i think the program must have been shortened as we were only there in total for a hour so definitely worth it.

tripreview.Title: "Kathakali ......weird but amazing .... not to be missed"
tripreview.sentence: We had no idea about Kathakali but by the end we were enchanted.
We arrived early and watched the performers put on their makeup made from pure pigments and in striking colours.

Then there was an explanation of the movements and expressions which represented the various emotions of the performers but by the time the dance had started I had forgotten which was which but was enchanted by the whole thing: the music, the drumming and the actors.
Luckily we had been given a "crib sheet" with the story based on the Mahabharatha and could follow what was happening.
It was an amazing experience and we are so glad we went.
The centre runs a great many activities and it is certainly worthwhile finding out.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing morning meditation with musicians"
tripreview.sentence: Really relaxing and beautiful meditation where you just lie down and listen to the wonderful 'Ragas' from the singer and musicians.
It was one of the most peaceful experiences I've ever had - thoroughly recommend it if you are up at 8am.

tripreview.Title: "A reat ay to spend a few hours in the Evening"
tripreview.sentence: At first I was unsure about going to see the Kathakali Dancers, but was soon sitting in total amasment.
They do a different show each evening.
The use of facial expressions to state how they thought and felt was great.
Not only is there a dance session but there are also musical recitals, Indian marshal arts shows and yoga sessions.
I highly recommend a visit or to tho this centre.

tripreview.Title: "must see,"
tripreview.sentence: I to be honest was not to sure if i would like this, but i loved it, they give u a hand out with the general story of what you will be seeing, it is worth reading it as it make the acting easier to follow , the way they put there make up on is amazing,and the fact it takes years for them to learn how to do it, also the martial arts is amazing, really think every one should visit .
oh there is no flash photography if your going to be taking pictures but i did get some pictures on my little camera, but i guess if your a camera ham ,with the fancy lens you will know what to do.

tripreview.Title: "Must go see this!"
tripreview.sentence: Make sure you can go early and watch the performers pu heir makeup on.
Tjis is fun to watch.
An the performance itself is well-worth seeing.
It is lots of fun!

tripreview.Title: "Culturally maxed out"
tripreview.sentence: The martial arts impressed me.
Kathakali was a unique experience.
Enjoyed watching the make-up being done.
The show itself can become a bit long and tedious, but still worth it.
Classical dancing was good for the soul.
Beautiful.

tripreview.Title: "Very strange"
tripreview.sentence: This was nothing like we expected.
Actors performing in dance and costume is one thing but relying upon facial movements to get their message across was just a little strange.
I'm sure it all means a great deal to the actors and local people, but it didn't quite hit the spot for us.
Personally I wouldn't recommend it.

tripreview.Title: "Nice Yoga Experience"
tripreview.sentence: At the Kathakali Centre they have Yoga lessons in the early morning.
It was a very good experience.
The teacher knew, what she was doing.

tripreview.Title: "Stunning!!"
tripreview.sentence: This is a great piece of Indian art.
Some people may find it hard to sit through n think it's boring but for me it was true art!
Storytelling like it used to be, all set to a rhythmic sequence that pulses throughout n the performers never miss a beat.
Such talent deserves the one hour or so of your time that these people have put into their amazing work.
I would highly recommend it to anyone!

tripreview.Title: "Great introduction to Kathakali theatre"
tripreview.sentence: I ended up going to the Kathakali Centre on a suggestion from a fellow traveler I had met who had just spent a few weeks filming a production and I was totally blown away!
It was an amazing and different way to spend an evening in Kochi.
The performance was brilliant and it was really insightful getting there early to watch the make up application and the Kathakali expression introduction.
The room was well air conditioned, clean and comfy.
This is a must for anyone staying in Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Dont miss!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Don't be skeptical, just go.
We arrived 15 minutes before the 18:00 show and it was enough to look at the artists paiting themselves.
The show was stunning!

tripreview.Title: "great cultural entertainment"
tripreview.sentence: had a very enjoyable few hours watching this.

tripreview.Title: "Great way to appreciate Keralaan heritage"
tripreview.sentence: We went for the classical indian music performance on sunday.
We were captivated and enthralled by the exquisite play of the tabla player and esp the sitar player.
The combination of both of them playing brought us to a different world.
into a realm of mystical imagination.
The kathakali performance was pleasantly interesting to say the least.
The unique usage of their facial expressions and gestures was really something to behold.

tripreview.Title: "A unique experience"
tripreview.sentence: We were a bit concerned beforehand that this would be a bit boring, especially as we had opted to see the martial arts display which preceded the kathakali spectacle (which meant four hours' in total).
However, we were very impressed and not at all bored.

The martial arts (including swords and some sort of long metal whip unique to Kerala) was immensely impressive and the kathakali was very interesting, especially as the centre provides a background note to explain the spectacle.
This was probably the best thing we did in Kochi itself!

tripreview.Title: "An interesting art form!"
tripreview.sentence: It is well worth having a look at the Kathakali Dance Show which goes from 5.0pm - 7.0pm.
The drums are very loud so my tip would be take some earplugs in case you need them and a couple of panadol.
The actual dance segment lasts about 30 minutes and they tell you in the real life village situation it can last 10 hours!
30 minutes is enough!
Good toilet facility here.
On the night we went it was 3/4 fill at just after 5.0pm, so watch you don't miss out.

tripreview.Title: "Magnificant"
tripreview.sentence: Highly recommended!
We arrived early (more than an hour before the show) to watch the preparations to the Kathakali dance show.
Watched 3 men transform (in a very lengthy process) into colorful performers (as a girl, a magician, and a prince).
Cameras did not stop clicking, it was so beautiful!
Then, the leader explained about the show and the movements which really helped to understand it, and the show begun.
No spoilers you have to see it for yourself!

tripreview.Title: "Khatakali dances"
tripreview.sentence: The set-up of the small theater that allowed good viewing of the stage, its opening earlier to allow seeing the preparation of the actors,and the ardor and commitment of the musicians.

tripreview.Title: "Magical"
tripreview.sentence: We went to to see a martial arts performance and kathakali dance show here and loved it!
The host and all the performers put on a great show and it's clear that they are all so passionate about their art, and culture and tradition.
The theatre is very pretty and the shows make for a great night out.

tripreview.Title: "Martial Arts display"
tripreview.sentence: We went to see the martial arts display.
It was OK.
The room was very hot and the display was rather strung out.
Despite paying for the entrance ticket there was an expectation of tipping the performers too.
We wouldn't rush back.

tripreview.Title: "great dancers"
tripreview.sentence: kathkali center in thekkady was great experince.
the dances get moves of lips and eyes were wow.
and offcorse their makup was good,when we asked how much time it takes,and they replied 3-4 hours.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting but a bit too long"
tripreview.sentence: Starts and hour before the actual show with the makeup for the show being applied on the stage followed by an introduction to the story.
There is seating in front of the stage and a small balcony area on each side.
It is a relatively small area with split system airconditioning cooling the room but it still became stuffy.
The makeup was complex and was good how they incorportated it into part of the show.
The facial expressions, story and costumes tell the story without any spoken word.

tripreview.Title: "Simple but fun!"
tripreview.sentence: We went to see a Kathakali performance.
It was good fun to see the art form so up and close.
The place is pretty basic but if you like dance, music and cultural you should enjoy it!

tripreview.Title: "Kathakali Centre"
tripreview.sentence: You can get there an hour before the performance and watch the actors apply their elaborate make-up.
There is somewhat of a humorous element as well.

tripreview.Title: "a fascinating insight."
tripreview.sentence: My only dislike was the rude audience members who had no idea how to watch a live performance and who talked and laughed in an inappropriate manner.

tripreview.Title: "A cultural gem"
tripreview.sentence: Fabulous venue for dance and evening concerts.
At 6:30 am I took a great yoga class on the top floor with the sounds of the neighborhood roosters.
I stayed afterwards to hear a morning raga played on tabla and sitar -- so glad that I did.
